Jonel Carcueva Juarai Etape Lima Tour de Singkarak, Jaket Kuning Masih Dikuasai Jesse Ewart
06 Nov 2019, 20:17 by Yudi Prama Agustino



Jonel Carcueva Juarai Etape Lima Tour de Singkarak, Jaket Kuning Masih Dikuasai Jesse Ewart



Jonel Carcueva Juarai Etape Lima Tour de Singkarak, Jaket Kuning Masih Dikuasai Jesse Ewart



Jonel Carcueva Juarai Etape Lima Tour de Singkarak, Jaket Kuning Masih Dikuasai Jesse Ewart


KBRN, Bukittinggi : Pembalap asal Filipina Jonel Carcueva, berhasil menaklukkan rute terberat, etape lima iven Sport Tourism Tour de Singkarak (TdS), Rabu (6/11/2019), dengan lokasi start di objek wisata Ngalau Indah di Kota Payakumbuh, dan finish di Nuansa Maninjau Ambun Pagi Kabupaten Agam, sepanjang 206,5 kilometer.
Jonel Carcueva berhasil finish terdepan dengan catatan waktu 5 jam 34 menit 33 detik. Carcueva terpaut 17 detik dari pembalap Thailand, Thanakhan Chaiyasombat yang berada diposisi kedua. Dan selisih 26 detik dari pembalap Indonesia dari KFC Cycling Team, Agung Shabana.
Sedangkan pemuncak klasemen sementara dan pemegang Yellow Jersey serta Green Jersey yakni Jesse Ewart dari Team Sapura Cycling Team hanya mampu finish diurutan ke 9 dengan catatan waktu 5 jam 35 menit 12 detik.
Selain mampu finish diurutan ketiga, pembalap andalan Indonesia Agung Shabana terus menunjukkan tren positif. Pada etape V ini, Agung mampu menyabet gelar juara untuk kategori Best Indonesian Rider dengan total catatan waktu 5 jam 34 menit 59 detik.
Disusul peringkat kedua rekan setim Agung, Muhammad Abdurrohman yang membukukan waktu 5 jam 35 menit 12 detik dan diurutan ketiga Sandy Nur Hasan dari PGN dengan catatan waktu 5 jam 35 menit 12 detik.
“Rute ini sangat sulit dan berat. Namun saya dibantu oleh teman satu tim. Saya terima kasih kepada teman satu tim saya, yang sudah memberikan dukungan hingga bisa menjuarai nomor tiga,” ulasnya.
Senada dengan Agung, Jesse Ewart juga menilai rute pada etape ke lima ini cukup berat. Meski demikian, Ewart tetap konsisten mempertahankan posisi yang sudah ia raih hingga saat ini.
“Tujuan saya dari awal yakni, mempertahankan Yellow Jersey atau Jaket Kuning. Namun juga, tetap berusaha untuk mendapatkan dan pertahankan Green Jersey atau Jaket Hijau,” ujarnya.
Hingga etape lima ini, Jesse Ewart masih kokoh di puncak klasemen sementaa dengan total waktu 19 menit 13 menit 25 detik, selisih 59 detik dari pembalap asal Sapura Cycling Team, Cristian Raileanu yang bertengger diurutan kedua dan terpaut 3 menit 12 detik dari Janel Carcueva yang menempati urutan ketiga.
Sedangkan untuk gelar juara Best Climber’s Classification atau raja tanjakan pada etape ini direbut oleh pembalap Ismael Grospe Jr dari Go For Gold Philippines dengan total 58 poin.
Menurut Grospe Jr, lintasan etape ini, terutama disaat mulai menanjak di rute kelok 44, sangatlah berat. Namun akhirnya ia mampu melepaskan diri dari pleton. Hingga akhirnya mampu meraih gelar juara tanjakan.
Sementara itu, Bupati Agam Indra Catri, mengatakan, Pemerintah Kabupaten Agam memastikan tidak ada kendala yang menjadi penghambat para pembalap saat melintasi kelok 44, dan rute kali ini baru ditemukan oleh event organizer Tour de Singkarak, dengan memulai balapan di Kota Payakumbuh dan finish di Kabupaten Agam.
Hari ini cuaca sangat cerah, sehingga para pembalap bisa menikmati keindahan alam kelok 44 yang dilatarbelakangi Danau Maninjau.
Menurut Indra Catri, Selama ini kelok 44 menjadi rute yang sulit untuk ditaklukkan, sesuai namanya terdapat 44 tikungan secara beruntun dibarengi tanjakan yang bakal menguji kemampuan dan fisik para pembalap.
“Pada etape lima ini pembalap disuguhi rute menantang, butuh kerja keras yang luar biasa dan menguras tenaga untuk melaluinya, terutama pada dua lokasi tanjakan menantang, pertama di daerah pendakian di Kecamatan Baso, dan kedua di Kelok 44 hingga finish di Ambun Pagi Kecamatan Matur Kabupaten Agam,” ungkapnya.
Dilokasi ini sambung Indra Catri, seluruh pembalap diuji tenaga dan kekuatan pembalap dalam mendayung sepeda melewati tanjakan melingkar agar bisa sampai ke garis finish. Seperti tahun sebelumnya, penakluk kelok 44 dengan waktu tercepat dijuluki sebagai raja tanjakan atau “King of Mountain”. 
Pada kesempatan yang sama Wakil Gubernur Sumatera Barat, Nasrul Abit, menuturkan, pemerintah provinsi mengharapkan fasilitas pendukung di setiap kabupaten dan kota penyelenggara segera dimaksimalkan, agar manfaat TdS lebih dapat dirasakan oleh masyarakat.
"Di tahun-tahun pelaksanaan event Tour de Singkarak ini mendatang, tersebar hotel dan penginapan yang dimanfaatkan oleh seluruh pembalap dan tim offisial. Semoga investasi masuk, baik dari pemodal lokal maupun dari luar," tukasnya.

Jonel Carcueva Wins Stage Five Tour de Singkarak, Yellow Jacket Still controlled by Jesse Ewart
Nov 6, 2019, 20:17 by Yudi Prama Agustino



Jonel Carcueva Wins Stage Five Tour de Singkarak, Yellow Jacket Still controlled by Jesse Ewart



Jonel Carcueva Wins Stage Five Tour de Singkarak, Yellow Jacket Still controlled by Jesse Ewart



Jonel Carcueva Wins Stage Five Tour de Singkarak, Yellow Jacket Still controlled by Jesse Ewart


KBRN, Bukittinggi: Racer from the Philippines Jonel Carcueva, managed to conquer the toughest route, stage five of the Sport Tourism Tour de Singkarak (TdS), Wednesday (11/06/2019), with the starting location at the Ngalau Indah attraction in Payakumbuh City, and finishing in Nuansa Maninjau Ambun Pagi, Agam Regency, along 206.5 kilometers.
Jonel Carcueva managed to finish ahead with a record time of 5 hours 34 minutes 33 seconds. Carcueva is 17 seconds adrift of Thai racer Thanakhan Chaiyasombat who is second. And the difference of 26 seconds from the Indonesian racer from the KFC Cycling Team, Agung Shabana.
While the top standings and Yellow Jersey and Green Jersey holders Jesse Ewart from the Sapura Cycling Team were only able to finish 9th with a time of 5 hours 35 minutes 12 seconds.
Besides being able to finish third, Indonesian mainstay racer Agung Shabana continues to show a positive trend. In this stage V, Agung was able to win the title for the Best Indonesian Rider category with a total record time of 5 hours 34 minutes 59 seconds.
Followed by second place was Agung's teammate Muhammad Abdurrohman who recorded 5 hours 35 minutes 12 seconds and third place Sandy Nur Hasan from PGN with a record time of 5 hours 35 minutes 12 seconds.
"This route is very difficult and heavy. But I was assisted by a teammate. I thank my teammates, who have provided support so that they can win number three, "he said.
In line with Agung, Jesse Ewart also considered the route on the fifth stage to be quite heavy. Nevertheless, Ewart remained consistent in maintaining the position he had achieved to date.
"My goal from the beginning is to maintain the Yellow Jersey or Yellow Jacket. But also, keep trying to get and maintain Green Jersey or Green Jacket, "he said.
Until this fifth stage, Jesse Ewart is still firm at the top of the standings with a total time of 19 minutes 13 minutes 25 seconds, 59 seconds difference from the racers from Sapura Cycling Team, Cristian Raileanu who perched second and 3 minutes 12 seconds adrift 3 minutes 12 seconds adrift of Janel Carcueva third order.
As for the title of Best Climber's Classification or king of climbs on this stage was taken by racer Ismael Grospe Jr. from Go For Gold Philippines with a total of 58 points.
According to Grospe Jr., the stage of this stage, especially when starting uphill on the Route 44, is very heavy. But finally he was able to break away from the platoon. Until finally able to win the title climb.
Meanwhile, the Regent of Agam Indra Catri, said, the Government of Agam Regency ensured that there were no obstacles that impeded the drivers when crossing the 44 turns, and this time the route was only discovered by the event organizer Tour de Singkarak, by starting the race in Payakumbuh City and finishing in the Regency Agam
Today the weather is very sunny, so the racers can enjoy the natural beauty of the 44 turns behind Lake Maninjau.
According to Indra Catri, up to now 44 turns have become a difficult route to conquer, as the name implies there are 44 turns in a row accompanied by grades that will test the ability and physicality of the racers.
"In stage five, drivers are treated to challenging routes, it takes extraordinary hard work and is draining to get through it, especially in two challenging uphill locations, first in the climbing area in Baso District, and second in Kelok 44 to finish at Ambun Pagi, Matur District, Regency Agam, "he said.
In this location continued Indra Catri, all racers were tested for the strength and strength of the racers in rowing their bikes over a circular incline to get to the finish line. Like the previous year, conqueror 44 with the fastest time was dubbed the king of the hill or "King of Mountain".
On the same occasion the Deputy Governor of West Sumatra, Nasrul Abit, said, the provincial government expects supporting facilities in each regency and city of the organizer to be maximized immediately, so that the benefits of TdS can be more felt by the community.
"In the coming years of the upcoming Tour de Singkarak event, hotels and inns are spread which are utilized by all racers and official teams. Hopefully the investment will come in, both from local investors and from outside," he said.
